transcripts.text: Great questions, by the way.

Let's talk about like killing babies.  Oh, it was gory though.  So what I wanted to say though, was I encourage everyone in this audience to actually realize like what it means to be to have bodily autonomy, to be pro-choice, which is not pro-abortion.  It's pro-choose.  No, yeah, I'm getting that.  It's pro-choosing the right to have an abortion if you feel that's necessary.  So I want to ask the question, what makes you qualified to tell everyone here that abortion is so bad and it should be illegal when in reality, are you a scientist?  Are you an OBGYN?  Do you have any kind of degree?  that makes it so like we should be listening to you because you're, oh my gosh, you're this figure that is, So correct on all these issues like I I want to hear what you have to say about like your background.  that makes this.

Well, it's actually simple because abortion is a black and white issue.  You don't have to be an OBGYN.  You don't have to be a doctor.  You don't have to be a scientist to read biology books and to Google when human life begins and to know innately that all human life is equally valuable.  And when you start to disregard certain human beings because they're inconvenient to you or you see them as your property to dispose of how you see fit, the disastrous results we've seen throughout human history.

Though as a counter to that, I wanted to say I noticed a lot of your sources.  you seem to Google.  So that kind of goes into my topic of what makes you qualified to talk about this if you Googled it.  Because everything on the news is accurate, I guess.

But it's actually very simple in the pro-life movement because what is abortion?  What does it do?  What does abortion do, ma'am?
It allows women to have the right to choose to move on with their lives and not have to have a baby.

Does a clump of cells have a beating heart?
Well, I'm not a scientist, so honestly, what I will say... Google it!  Yeah, okay, so everything on the internet is correct.  I'm confused as to... This is sarcasm, by the way.

I don't agree that there's any kind of murder in the dictionary.
